mining_method: Open pit, conventional truck and shovel; remote-controlled shovels, drills, and dozers used in legacy underground mining areas​
processing_method: Conventional crushing, grinding, gravity concentration, cyanide leaching, and carbon-in-pulp recovery​

name: Snow Lake
deposit_type: Volcanogenic Massive Sulphide (VMS) — Cu-Zn and Zn-Cu rich, and structurally controlled lode-gold vein-type for New Britannia and other gold zones
mining_depth:
Lalor’s mineralized lenses reach ~800 meters vertical depth​.
The 3 Zone and New Britannia workings reach around 130 meters depth
mining_method:
Lalor: Cut and fill & Longhole open stoping
1901: Post-Pillar Mechanized Cut & Fill (PPMCAF) and Inclined Room & Pillar
WIM/3 Zone: Longhole retreat​
processing_method:
Stall Mill: Crush, grind, flotation for Cu, Zn, Au
New Britannia: Grind, flotation, leaching (for Au), refining. Flotation tails optionally leached​

name: Copper Mountain
deposit_type: Alkalic porphyry copper–gold deposit (silica saturated), typical of BC's Cordillera deposits​
mining_depth: Open pit operation — final pit depth not explicitly provided, but standard practice for similar porphyry copper mines suggests ~400–600 meters depth
mining_method: Open pit mining with blasting, loading, and hauling using shovels and 220-tonne haul trucks​
processing_method: Crush–grind–flotation: SAG mill + ball mill + pebble crusher; sulphide flotation producing Cu-Ag-Au concentrate
